thread.title: Talks on UN climate deal heat up over bill to fix problems
thread.title_full: Talks on UN climate deal heat up over bill to fix problems - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Talks on UN climate deal heat up over bill to fix problems
text:
By KARL RITTER
Associated Press BONN, Germany (AP) - The trillion-dollar question of who should pay for global warming is coming to a head in talks on an international climate pact, as developing countries worry they won't get enough money to tackle the problem.
With just five weeks left before a U.N. climate summit in Paris, developing countries closed ranks at weeklong talks ending Friday in Bonn, calling on wealthy nations to make firm financial commitments to help them fight and adapt to climate change.
The Paris summit "will be judged by what is contained in the core agreement on finance. For us, that will be the yardstick for success," said Nozipho Mxakato-Diseko of South Africa, who chairs a developing country bloc of 134 countries.
